required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Not a Drug Trial. We Are Using Anti-IgE to Examine the Role of Pulmonary Mast Cells in Asthma

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

brief_summary.textblock: We are using anti-IgE to investigate the role of pulmonary mast cells in asthma.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects with mild allergic asthma are examined before, immediately after and 2 months after a course of treatment with anti-IgE. The following are examined: Allergen skin tests, allergen induced asthma, peripheral blood basophils, pulmonary bronchial mucosal mast cells.

primary_outcome.measure: Anti-KLH Antibody. This is Measured by ELISA and Expressed as ELISA Units Which Are Derived by Dilution of Serum Samples Until the Result Falls on a Linear Portion of the Response Curve. Final Values Are Derived From ELISA Units and the Serum Dilution
primary_outcome.description: Asthma and control patients are immunized with KLH. Mean levels of anti-KLH antibody as described above. This is measured by ELISA and expressed as ELISA units which are derived by dilution of serum samples until the result falls on a linear portion of the response curve. Final values are derived from ELISA units and the serum dilution

arm_group.description: This is a single arm, parallel study examining differences of therapeutic outcomes of Xolair. Xolair is being examined as an intervention that might change the outcome of immunization.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Mild asthma, adults -
Exclusion Criteria:
children. on inhaled or systemic steroids
-

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: No events prior to the study

group.title: Xolair
group.description: This is not a drug study examining differences of therapeutic outcomes. This is an open label, non randomized single dose level study in which patients will be treated for 85 days with rhuMAB-E25 (Xolair) and followed for a total of 300 days. The dose of Xolair is determined by the patient's total serum IgE and body weight and is administered subcutaneously every 2 or 4 weeks. Outcome is serum anti-KLH antibody (immunoglobulin classes).

group.title: Xolair
group.description: This is not a drug study examining differences of therapeutic outcomes. It uses Xolair as an intervention that might change the outcome of immunization.

outcome.title: Anti-KLH Antibody. This is Measured by ELISA and Expressed as ELISA Units Which Are Derived by Dilution of Serum Samples Until the Result Falls on a Linear Portion of the Response Curve. Final Values Are Derived From ELISA Units and the Serum Dilution
outcome.description: Asthma and control patients are immunized with KLH. Mean levels of anti-KLH antibody as described above. This is measured by ELISA and expressed as ELISA units which are derived by dilution of serum samples until the result falls on a linear portion of the response curve. Final values are derived from ELISA units and the serum dilution
outcome.population: Anti-KLH antibody levels of the groups (asthmatics treated with Xolair and placebo) were compared. Both parametric and non parametric statistical techniques were used. There were no differences between the groups.

group.title: Xolair
group.description: This is not a drug study examining differences of therapeutic outcomes. It uses Xolair as an intervention that might change the outcome of immunization.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
